author: Staff Reporter
text:
Public Sector major Bharath Heavy Electricals Limited (BHEL), Tiruchi, has stepped up its commitment to the upkeep of animals at Arignar Anna Zoological Park in Vandalur. They have adopted a sea eagle and a Siamese crocodile for one year as part of their corporate social responsibility programme.

BHEL executive director S. Gopinath handed over a cheque for Rs. 3.19 lakh to zoo officials. Through the adoption programme, the company already lends its support to feed and upkeep the Nilgiri langur, grizzled giant squirrel, elephant and black buck. Zoo authorities said the company also adopted the sea eagle and Siamese crocodile for one year. It has adopted over a dozen animals from 2012, under the Animal Adoption Programme formulated by AAZP. “From 2011, when they donated Rs. 97,690, they have donated a total of Rs. 11,29,286,” said zoo director K.S.S.V.P. Reddy. In 2009, the zoo began an ‘adopt an animal programme’, which allows wildlife enthusiasts to adopt any wild species, individually or in a group.

The minimum period of adoption is a day, and rates vary depending on the animal. The money given by the sponsor covers the adopted animal’s food, according to zoo officials.
title: BHEL adopts more animals at Vandalur Zoo
